results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Search and Seizure;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Garland, Merrick B;Justice Department;Federal Bureau of Investigation;National Archives and Records Administration;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla)
results.byline: By Glenn Thrush, Charlie Savage, Alan Feuer and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Documents at Mar-a-Lago Were Moved and Hidden as U.S. Sought Them, Filing Suggests
results.abstract: The filing by the Justice Department paints the clearest picture to date of its efforts to retrieve documents from the former president’s Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida.

media.caption: The Justice Department included a photo of documents seized from former President Donald J. Trump’s Florida home in its court filing.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Longevity;Age, Chronological;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Deaths (Fatalities);Native Americans;Alaska Natives;Whites;Black People;Hispanic-Americans;Asian-Americans;National Center for Health Statistics;United States
results.title: U.S. Life Expectancy Falls Again in ‘Historic’ Setback
results.abstract: The decline during the pandemic is the sharpest in nearly 100 years, hitting Native American and Alaska Native communities particularly hard.

media.caption: A patient who died of Covid was removed from an I.C.U. in Cleveland, Ohio.

results.adx_keywords: Suicides and Suicide Attempts;Families and Family Life;Privacy;Judd, Naomi
results.title: Ashley Judd: The Right to Keep Private Pain Private
results.abstract: I could not help my mother, Naomi Judd, who lost a long battle against mental illness. I can, however, do something about how she is remembered.

results.adx_keywords: Voting Rights, Registration and Requirements;Referendums;Supreme Courts (State);Decisions and Verdicts;United States Politics and Government;Republican Party;Democratic Party;Arizona
results.title: Arizona’s Supreme Court blocks an election reform ballot measure, voiding over 238,000 petition signatures.
results.abstract: The Arizona Free and Fair Elections Act would have established same-day voter registration and prohibited the state Legislature from overturning federal election results.

media.caption: The Arizona Supreme Court affirmed a lower court judge’s earlier decision to reject more than 238,000 signatures from the petition to place the measure on the ballot.
media.copyright: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces;Monuments and Memorials (Structures);United States Politics and Government;Fringe Groups and Movements;Black People;Discrimination;Ku Klux Klan;Defense Department;United States Military Academy;Confederate States of America
results.title: Plaque Bearing Image of Hooded K.K.K. Figure Hangs at West Point
results.abstract: A special congressional commission that recommends the removal of Confederate symbols at U.S. military sites flagged the image, which appears above the words “Ku Klux Klan,” in a new report.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: The U.S. Military Academy at West Point. A congressional panel flagged an image of a hooded figure that appears on a plaque mounted at the entrance of Bartlett Hall Science Center.

results.title: What to Know About the New Booster Shots
results.abstract: The F.D.A. just cleared new shots targeting the latest version of the Omicron variant. When should you get yours? Here’s what experts recommend.

media.caption: The new shots target the Omicron subvariant BA.5, the dominant version of the virus.
media.copyright: Charity Rachelle for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Search and Seizure;Executive Privilege, Doctrine of;Classified Information and State Secrets;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Bharara, Preet;Garland, Merrick B;Trump, Donald J;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla)
results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Glenn Thrush
results.title: Trump’s Legal Jab Left Him Open to Justice Dept. Strike
results.abstract: A legal back-and-forth produced a straightforward narrative of how Mr. Trump and his lawyers repeatedly dodged the government’s attempts to recover sensitive documents for more than a year.

media.caption: The Justice Department used a routine court filing to disclose new evidence that former President Donald J. Trump and his legal team may have interfered with the inquiry.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Racial Profiling;Black People;Jennings, Michael (1966- );Childersburg (Ala)
results.title: Alabama Pastor Is Arrested While Watering Neighbor’s Flowers, Video Shows
results.abstract: The Rev. Michael Jennings, a pastor of 31 years, had been watering petunias and hydrangeas when a neighbor called the police to report suspicious activity, his lawyer said.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Actors and Actresses;Cannes International Film Festival;Dean, Charlbi
results.title: Charlbi Dean, Star of Top Winner at Cannes, Dies at 32
results.abstract: A South African-born actress and model, she had a breakout role in the satirical “Triangle of Sadness,” due in theaters in the fall.

media.caption: The model and actress Charlbi Dean, who starred in the film “Triangle of Sadness” and was a regular on the CW superhero series “Black Lightning.”

results.title: Moosewood, the Beloved Vegetarian Restaurant, Prepares for Its Second Act
results.abstract: The Ithaca, N.Y., destination was revolutionary because of its menu and its collective ownership model. Recently, the new owners hosted a dinner to celebrate its past and future.

media.caption: The dinner, which featured sweet pea hummus; baby beet salad; Orecchiette with pea shoots, carrots and French radishes; and chickpea stew with panisses, was served family style.

results.title: Ron DeSantis Is a Test Case
results.abstract: The DeSantis governorship provides insight into what our national life might look like if in 2024 the Republicans make a clean sweep.

media.copyright: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations;Bachelet, Michelle;United Nations;United Nations Human Rights Council;Xinjiang (China);China
results.byline: By Nick Cumming-Bruce and Austin Ramzy
results.title: U.N. Says China May Have Committed ‘Crimes Against Humanity’ in Xinjiang
results.abstract: The organization’s human rights office delivered its much-delayed report minutes before Michelle Bachelet, the U.N. high commissioner for human rights, was to leave office.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media.caption: A security guard at a detention center in Yarkant County, Xinjiang, China, last year. Delays to the U.N. report about abuses in the region prompted fierce pushback from rights groups.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);United States Politics and Government;Medicine and Health;Polls and Public Opinion;Fauci, Anthony S
results.title: Why Many Americans Turned on Anthony Fauci
results.abstract: A science worth following must lead.

media.copyright: Illustration by Zisiga Mukulu/The New York Times; photograph by Doug Mills/The New York Times

results.title: A Utica Sculpture Studio Is Ransacked, and 5 Children Are Arrested
results.abstract: Sculpture Space, a residency program, was vandalized over the weekend. The police said Tuesday they had charged five juveniles between the ages of 8 and 11 in connection with the crime.

media.caption: Officials at Sculpture Space, a residency program for artists, shared this photograph showing the damage to its studio in Utica, N.Y., after it was vandalized.

results.adx_keywords: Customs, Etiquette and Manners;Content Type: Service;internal-sub-only
results.title: Why Did My Ex-Husband Catfish Me on a Dating App?
results.abstract: A reader wading back into the dating pool is angered to have been duped by her ex, who chatted with her using a false identity for weeks.

results.title: Serena Williams’s Magical Run at the U.S. Open Isn’t Over Yet
results.abstract: If two nights earlier was about posterity and sweet send-offs, Round 2 was about doing everything possible to win a tennis match, as Williams beat the world No. 2, Anett Kontaveit, in three sets.

media.copyright: Michelle V. Agins/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Draft and Recruitment (Military);Defense and Military Forces;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);War and Armed Conflicts;Politics and Government;Putin, Vladimir V;Russia;Ukraine
results.title: A Draft for Russia’s Army? Putin Opts for Domestic Stability Instead.
results.abstract: Western officials are puzzled by the Russian leader’s decision to avoid mass conscription. But analysts say he is intent on maintaining a sense of normalcy to prevent any public backlash.

media.caption: Russian conscripts boarding a train to their garrisons in Omsk, Russia, in June. Conscripts serving their required year of military service are not fighting in Ukraine, according to the Kremlin.

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Governors;Conservatism (US Politics);Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Fringe Groups and Movements;Mastriano, Doug;Shapiro, Josh (1973- );Facebook Inc;Republican Party;Pennsylvania
results.title: The Extremely Online Rise of Doug Mastriano
results.abstract: The G.O.P. candidate for governor of Pennsylvania deftly used Facebook to build a loyal right-wing fan base at the height of the pandemic. Will it be enough to win a competitive general election?

media.caption: Although Doug Mastriano is perhaps better known for challenging the results of the 2020 presidential election, he built a loyal following with pandemic livestreams on Facebook.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elections, House of Representatives;Palin, Sarah;Peltola, Mary;Alaska
results.title: Mary Peltola, a Democrat, Defeats Sarah Palin in Alaska’s Special House Election
results.abstract: Ms. Peltola notched a major upset against Ms. Palin and will finish the remaining four months of the term of Representative Don Young, who died in March.

media.caption: Mary Peltola’s victory in Alaska adds to a series of recent wins for Democrats.
media.copyright: Ash Adams for The New York Times

results.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Marc Santora and Lynsey Addario
results.title: The experts’ convoy of armored S.U.V.s traveled toward an active battlefield.
